summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Economic Development Committee of the Dallas City Council is convening on October 7, 2024, at 1:00 PM in the Council Chambers and via videoconference. The purpose of this meeting is to discuss various economic development initiatives and proposals affecting the city.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the September 3, 2024, meeting.
2. Briefing on the 2024 Survey of Dallas business owners.
3. Discussion of the East Dock Redevelopment Project at East Clarendon Drive and South Ewing Avenue.
4. Recommendations for nominees to fill two vacancies on the Dallas Economic Development Corporation Board of Directors.
5. Update on the Self-Certification Program.
6. Oversize Motor Vehicle Regulation updates.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will include a presentation by Jason Morado regarding the business owners' survey and a memorandum from Kevin Spath on the East Dock Redevelopment Project. Additionally, updates on regulatory changes concerning oversize vehicles and the self-certification program will be provided by Emily Liu.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval for the minutes, discuss and potentially approve the nominees for the Economic Development Corporation Board, and review the proposed updates on the East Dock Redevelopment Project and regulatory changes. The meeting may also include an executive session to discuss legal and negotiation matters related to the agenda items.
